intro: Phyteuma alpestre, commonly known as the alpine phyteuma, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in late summer, producing violet or blue flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Phyteuma alpestre is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes at high altitudes.
